desc1.pins1: PEN - This is a programming enable pin for the SPI Serial Programming mode. By holding this pin low during a Power-on Reset, the device will enter the SPI Serial Programming mode. PEN has no function during normal operation.

desc2.pins2: RXD - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up.

desc3.pins2: TXD - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output.
desc3.pins3: PDO - SPI Serial Programming Data output. During Serial Program Downloading, this pin is used as data output line.

desc6.pins2: INT4 - External Interrupt source 4 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc7.pins2: INT5 - External Interrupt source 5 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc8.pins2: INT6 - External Interrupt source 6 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc9.pins2: INT7 - External Interrupt source 7 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc10.pins2: /SS - Slave Select pin for using with SPI.

desc11.pins2: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

desc12.pins2: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.

desc13.pins2: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

desc14.pins2: OC0 - Output Compare Match Output. Pin can serve as an external output for timer 0 compare match. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description for further details, and how to enable the output.

desc15.pins2: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc16.pins2: OC1B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc17.pins2: OC2 - Timer/Counter2 output compare match output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter2 output compare. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC2 pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc18.pins1: TOSC2 - Timer Oscillator pin 2 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.

desc19.pins1: TOSC1 - Timer Oscillator pin 1 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.

desc20.pins1: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.

desc23.pins1: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

desc24.pins1: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)

desc25.pins2: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc26.pins2: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc27.pins2: INT2 - External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc28.pins2: INT3 - External Interrupt source 3 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc29.pins2: ICP1 - Timer/Counter1 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter1 description for further details.

desc31.pins2: T1 - Timer/Counter1 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc32.pins2: T2 - Timer/Counter2 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc33.pins1: /WR - Write strobe signal for XRAM, active low

desc34.pins1: /RD - Read strobe signal for XRAM, active low

desc35.pins2: A8 - Address bit A8 for XRAM

desc36.pins2: A9 - Address bit A9 for XRAM

desc37.pins2: A10 - Address bit A10 for XRAM

desc38.pins2: A11 - Address bit A11 for XRAM

desc39.pins2: A12 - Address bit A12 for XRAM

desc40.pins2: A13 - Address bit A13 for XRAM

desc41.pins2: A14 - Address bit A14 for XRAM

desc42.pins2: A15 - Address bit A15 for XRAM

desc43.pins1: ALE - Address latch enable for XRAM

desc44.pins2: AD7 - Address/Data bit A7/D7 for XRAM

desc45.pins2: AD6 - Address/Data bit A6/D6 for XRAM

desc46.pins2: AD5 - Address/Data bit A5/D5 for XRAM

desc47.pins2: AD4 - Address/Data bit A4/D4 for XRAM

desc48.pins2: AD3 - Address/Data bit A3/D3 for XRAM

desc49.pins2: AD2 - Address/Data bit A2/D2 for XRAM

desc50.pins2: AD1 - Address/Data bit A1/D1 for XRAM

desc51.pins2: AD0 - Address/Data bit A0/D0 for XRAM

desc62.pins1: AREF - Reference voltage for AD converter.

desc64.pins1: AVCC - Power supply for AD converter.
